page.title: 15Health.
page.content: Just opposite our school there is a big house belonging to Dr.Mackensie. At the side of the house there used to be a surgery, where everyone who was ill went to see the doctors. Two years ago a new health centre was built in the next village of Gilberdyke. It is very good. The doctors wanted a heart monitor for the new centre but they did not have enough money to buy one. So my mum, Mrs Waddingham, who plays for the local darts team, said that she would organise a darts tournament to raise money for the heart monitor. The money was soon raised and the darts teams asked the doctor to come to accept the cheque for the monitor. The doctor presented my mum with a trophy as her team won the final match.My mum said that it was hard work raising the money. Gary Waddingham.
